Â 

Welcome to all new and returning students. We hope your stay will be a pleasant one.


We wish you all well for he upcoming year and may you progress with your academics.

Â 

From Management Team

title: CS Honours 2017

description:
POSTGRADUATE CENTRE AND FUNDING OFFICE
Current Information

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

Â 

1

STUDENTS PROCEEDING FROM UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE TO THE HONOURS DEGREE ARE NO LONGER ELIGIBLE FOR NSFAS LOANS AND FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES.

2

THE UNIVERSITY IS UNABLE TO PROVIDE FULL-COST FUNDING TO POST-GRADUATE STUDENTS.

3

AWARDS OFFERED TO SUCCESSFUL APPLICANTS ARE A CONTRIBUTION TOWARDS THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AT UCT.

4

APPLICANTS ARE THEREFORE STRONGLY ADVISED TO SOURCE EXTERNAL/ALTERNATIVE FUNDS TO ASSIST THEM TO COVER THE FULL COST OF ATTENDANCE.

5

IN ORDER TO MEET THE DEMAND FOR MERIT AWARDS, INTENDING STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR UCT MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NRF BURSARIES ARE REQUIRED TO APPLY FOR BOTH UCT MERIT AND NRF AWARDS. APPLICANTS WHO ARE UNSUCCESSFUL FOR NRF AWARDS WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR UCT MERIT AWARDS.

6

NO HONOURS OR MASTERSâ APPLICANTS MAY HOLD AN NRF AND UCT MERIT AWARD CONCURRENTLY.

7

INTENDING STUDENTS ARE STRONGLY ADVISED TO SUBMIT UCT FUNDING APPLICATIONS BEFORE THE CLOSING DATES, REGARDLESS OF WHETHER OR NOT A DECISION HAS BEEN MADE TO REGISTER FOR STUDY OR ON THE AREA OF STUDY TO BE PURSUED.

8

INTENDING STUDENTS ARE CAUTIONED THAT NRF CLOSING DATES FOR MASTERâS AND DOCTORAL AWARDS AND POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCH FELLOWSHIPS ARE NORMALLY IN JULY OR AUGUST OF EACH YEAR

9

INTENDING STUDENTS WHO NEGLECT TO APPLY TO THE NRF WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED FOR UCT MERIT AWARDS

Please note that it takes 4 working days to process requests for official transcripts and duplicate degree certificates

Â 

Applying for Funding

The primary and most substantial form of assistance for students who undertake Honours, Masterâs and Doctoral study are the awards granted on the basis of academic performance.

It is important that students and prospective postdoctoral research fellows applying for funding comply with the requirements and submit applications on time and by the specific closing date. Late and incomplete applications will be disqualified.

Merit Awards

The major source of merit-based awards are the state-funded Research Council. (See Section 1 of our funding booklet). Students requiring UCT merit awards must apply, in the first instance, to the NRF.

UCT also awards scholarships each December to graduating students who have performed exceptionally well at UCT. Recipients are identified by the university and an application form for this category of award is not required. (See Section 7 of our funding booklet .)

Â Scholarships and bursaries funded from a variety of sources are available. These may be awarded to Heads of Departments or supervisors to students working on specific projects or programmes. Candidates should enquire as to the availability of such awards by consulting their Supervisors, Course convenors or Heads of academic departments.

Â 

Financial Need

It is important to note that

1.Students proceeding from undergraduate degrees to Honours are no longer eligible for NSFAS loans and Financial Aid packages,

2.the university is unable to provide full-cost funding to students and

3.Awards offered to successful applicants are a contribution towards the cost of attendance.

Prospective postgraduate students who are financially needy are required to complete the relevant section of the UCT Form for Postgraduate funding and to provide the required supporting documentation.Â  Such students will be means-tested, and where the means-test is met, a combination of bursaries may be offered.Â 

Students who do not meet the means-test criteria will be assessed for partial need and an award may be offered in such cases.Â 

It is important to note that:

4.Resources for student support are limited.Â  Therefore the University of Cape Town can give no guarantee whatsoever that an applicant will receive funding support.

5.The submission of an application form does not guarantee the provision of a loan or an award.

6.The university cannot consider assistance for the cost of dependents. Students must make arrangements to meet the cost of support of dependents where applicable.

Section 4 lists awards administered independently of UCT and enquiries should be directed to the Administrators/Trustees indicated.

Â 

EVERY EFFORT MUST BE MADE TO SECURE ASSISTANCE FROM SOURCES EXTERNAL TO UCT. http://www.uct.ac.za/usr/pgfo/External_websites_2015.pdfÂ 

Â 

International and Refugee Students

A limited number of scholarships are available to non-South African graduates who are residents of countries other than South Africa. These are awarded on a competitive basis with emphasis given to academic merit and to the seniority of candidates.Â 

The scholarships do not provide full-cost support. All UCT International and Refugee Students Scholarships are supplementary. Applying students must ensure that they have sufficient support for their studies. The scholarships are renewable for the duration of the course of study subject to satisfactory progress being maintained, up to a limit of 1 year at Honours level; for the 1st and 2nd years of Masterâs study, and the 1st, 2nd and 3rd years of Doctoral study. Applications for funding cannot be processed unless Applicants apply for admission through the UCT Admissions Office or the Faculty Office.

Â 

Employment

Individuals who are employed full-time (more than 20 hours per week) are not eligible for UCT funding support.

The regulations governing the NRF/ MRC bursaries and UCT awards permit some degree of concurrent part-time employment. Demonstratorships, Teaching Assistantships or Research Assistantships may be offered by your Department and details should be obtained from your supervisor or Head of Department. Subject to limitations on remuneration, award-holders may undertake part-time employment, provided weekly duties do not exceed 12 hours NRF (SET) and 12 hours NRF (SSH).Â 

Â 

Duration of Scholarship and Bursary Assistance

Research Council bursaries and UCT awards may be held for:

Â· Â  the first year of the Honours degree only;

Â· Â  the 1st and 2nd year of Masterâs study, and

Â· Â  the 1st, 2nd and 3rd years of Doctoral study. Renewal of awards for Masterâs and Doctoral study each year is subject to satisfactory progress and continued evidence of need in the case of need-based bursaries, and on the availability of funds. Students must make every effort to complete their studies within these periods.

It is important to note that funding will not be available beyond the above-mentioned tenures.Â 

NOTE: STUDENTS STUDYING FOR A SECOND DEGREE AT THE SAME LEVEL (e.g. Honours Graduate doing a second Honours Degree) ARE INELIGIBLE FOR UCT FUNDING.

Applications for renewal and continued assistance must be submitted annually by the relevant closing dates. Renewal of awards is NOT automatic and eligible students are required to apply for renewal annually.Â 

Â 

Application for Admission to Study and Registration

Applicants for financial assistance who are not already registered for the degree of their choice are reminded that they must also apply for admission to the University http://www.uct.ac.za/apply/applications/postgraduates/administration/ and should consult UCTâs Admissions Office or relevant Faculty Office for the closing dates. Although funding selection committees consider applicants who may not yet be registered for study, bursaries/scholarships that may be offered can only be claimed by students who have been accepted by the relevant academic department for the course/programme for which they applied. AN OFFER OF A SCHOLARSHIP DOES NOT IMPLY AN OFFER OF A PLACE TO STUDY.

Â 

Scholarships for International Study

The University does not offer scholarships for international study. However the respective research councils NRF (SET), NRF (SSH) & MRC are a major source of assistance for overseas study at the DOCTORAL degree level. Such overseas awards are made on the basis of academic excellence and the significance of the proposed study. Certain overseas universities may offer scholarships or bursaries to international students, or may be in a position to offer part-time employment in the form of Assistantships or Fellowships, which often include a waiver of academic fees. Students are advised to check with their intended institutions.

Â 

Postdoctoral Research Fellowships

The majority of opportunities are offered by independent donors and interested parties are advised to check with their department Heads and with the Postgraduate Funding Office regularly. The office also provides details of externally administered funding and other opportunities on an electronic noticeboard which can be found on http://www.uct.ac.za/research/pgfo/noticeboard/Â 

POSTGRADUATE CENTRE AND FUNDING OFFICE
Tel:021 650 3622
Email: pgfunding@uct.ac.za;

consulting their Supervisors, Course convenors or Heads of
academic departments.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Financial Need</span></p>
<p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">It is important to note
that </span></p> <p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">1.Students proceeding
from undergraduate degrees to Honours are no
longer eligible for NSFAS loans and Financial
Aid packages, </span></p> <p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">2.the university is
unable to provide full-cost funding to students
and </span></p> <p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">3.Awards offered to
successful applicants are a contribution towards the cost of
attendance. </span></p> <p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Prospective postgraduate
students who are financially needy are required to complete
the relevant section of the UCT Form for Postgraduate
funding and to provide the required supporting
documentation.  Such students will be means-tested, and
where the means-test is met, a combination of bursaries may
be offered. </span></p> <p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Students who do not meet
the means-test criteria will be assessed for partial need
and an award may be offered in such cases. </span></p>
<p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">It is important to note
that:</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">4.Resources for student
support are limited.  Therefore the University of Cape Town
can give no guarantee whatsoever that an applicant will
receive funding support.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">5.The submission of an
application form does not guarantee the provision of a loan
or an award.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">6.The university cannot
consider assistance for the cost of dependents. Students
must make arrangements to meet the cost of support of
dependents where applicable.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Section 4 lists awards
administered independently of UCT and enquiries should be
directed to the Administrators/Trustees
indicated.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">EVERY EFFORT MUST BE MADE
TO SECURE ASSISTANCE FROM SOURCES EXTERNAL TO UCT.
</span>http://www.uct.ac.za/usr/pgfo/External_websites_2015.pdf </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">International and Refugee
Students</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">A limited number of
scholarships are available to non-South African graduates
who are residents of countries other than South Africa.
These are awarded on a competitive basis with emphasis given
to academic merit and to the seniority of
candidates. </span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">The scholarships do not
provide full-cost support. All UCT International and Refugee
Students Scholarships are supplementary. Applying students
must ensure that they have sufficient support for their
studies. The scholarships are renewable for the duration of
the course of study subject to satisfactory progress being
maintained, up to a limit of 1 year at Honours level; for
the 1st and 2nd years of Master’s study, and the 1st, 2nd
and 3rd years of Doctoral study. Applications for funding
cannot be processed unless Applicants apply for admission
through the UCT Admissions Office or the Faculty
Office.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Employment</span></p>
<p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Individuals who are
employed full-time (more than 20 hours per week) are not
eligible for UCT funding support.</span></p> <p
align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">The regulations governing
the NRF/ MRC bursaries and UCT awards permit some degree of
concurrent part-time employment. Demonstratorships, Teaching
Assistantships or Research Assistantships may be offered by
your Department and details should be obtained from your
supervisor or Head of Department. Subject to limitations on
remuneration, award-holders may undertake part-time
employment, provided weekly duties do not exceed 12 hours
NRF (SET) and 12 hours NRF (SSH). </span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Duration of Scholarship
and Bursary Assistance</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Research Council
bursaries and UCT awards may be held
for:</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">·   the first year of the
Honours degree only;</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">·   the 1st and 2nd year
of Master’s study, and </span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">·   the 1st, 2nd and 3rd
years of Doctoral study. Renewal of awards for Master’s and
Doctoral study each year is subject to satisfactory progress
and continued evidence of need in the case of need-based
bursaries, and on the availability of funds. Students must
make every effort to complete their studies within these
periods.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">It is important to note
that funding will not be available beyond the
above-mentioned tenures. </span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">NOTE: STUDENTS STUDYING
FOR A SECOND DEGREE AT THE SAME LEVEL (e.g.
Honours Graduate doing a second Honours Degree)
ARE INELIGIBLE FOR UCT FUNDING.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Applications for renewal
and continued assistance must be submitted annually by the
relevant closing dates. Renewal of awards is NOT automatic
and eligible students are required to apply for renewal
annually. </span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;page-break-after: avoid;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Application for Admission
to Study and Registration</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Applicants for financial
assistance who are not already registered for the degree of
their choice are reminded that they must also apply for
admission to the University <a
href="http://www.uct.ac.za/apply/applications/postgraduates/administration/"
target="_blank">
http://www.uct.ac.za/apply/applications/postgraduates/administration/</a>
and should consult UCT’s Admissions Office or relevant
Faculty Office for the closing dates. Although funding
selection committees consider applicants who may not yet be
registered for study, bursaries/scholarships that may be
offered can only be claimed by students who have been
accepted by the relevant academic department for the
course/programme for which they applied. AN OFFER OF A
SCHOLARSHIP DOES NOT IMPLY AN OFFER OF A PLACE TO
STUDY.</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Scholarships for
International Study</span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">The University does not
offer scholarships for international study. However the
respective research councils NRF (SET), NRF (SSH) & MRC
are a major source of assistance for overseas study at the
DOCTORAL degree level. Such overseas awards are made on the
basis of academic excellence and the significance of the
proposed study. Certain overseas universities may offer
scholarships or bursaries to international students, or may
be in a position to offer part-time employment in the form
of Assistantships or Fellowships, which often include a
waiver of academic fees. Students are advised to check with
their intended institutions. </span></p> <p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;"> </p>
<p
style="text-align: left;text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Postdoctoral Research
Fellowships</span></p> <p align="left"
style="text-indent: 0;line-height: 100.0%;margin-top: 0;margin-bottom: 0;">
<span style="line-height: 20.8px;">The majority of
opportunities are offered by independent donors and
interested parties are advised to check with their
department Heads and with the Postgraduate Funding Office
regularly. The office also provides details of externally
administered funding and other opportunities on an
electronic noticeboard which can be found on
http://www.uct.ac.za/research/pgfo/noticeboard/ </span></p>
</td> <td bgcolor="#fbfafd"
style="border: 1.0px dotted rgb(211,211,211);" valign="top"
width="15%"> <p> <a

title: Funding for Postgraduates

description: This site contains the course materials for the 2017 Computer Science Honours Module in Information and Communications Technologies for Development (ICT4D). Please contact the Module TA (Christine Wanjiru) or the Honours TA (Chelsea-Joy van Wardle) to be added to the group.
htmlDescription: <p>This site contains the course materials for the 2017 Computer Science Honours Module in Information and Communications Technologies for Development (ICT4D). Please contact the Module TA (Christine Wanjiru) or the Honours TA (Chelsea-Joy van Wardle) to be added to the group.</p>
title: Intro to ICT4D

description: This site for my honours project Learn. It is used for testing ingestion and digestion of teaching material from Vula to the repository and from the repository to Vula.
htmlDescription: <p>This site for my honours project Learn. It is used for testing ingestion and digestion of teaching material from Vula to the repository and from the repository to Vula.</p>
title: Learn

description:
This Site will be used as a means to share key communication from the following Councils & RADC Living & Learning projects:

Residence Academic Development Committee (RADC)Â 

Mentorship Council

IT Forum

Residence Tutors Council (RTC)

Sports Council

Wellness & Residence Environment CouncilÂ 

NB: If you have any questions and comments please contact the council member for the concerned council in your residence, Thank you
htmlDescription: <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">This Site will be used as a means to share key communication from the following Councils &amp; RADC Living &amp; Learning projects:</span></p>  <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">Residence Academic Development Committee (RADC) </span><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>  <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">Mentorship Council</span><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>  <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">IT Forum </span><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>  <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">Residence Tutors Council (RTC)</span><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>  <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">Sports Council</span><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>  <p><span style="font-family: times new roman;">Wellness &amp; Residence Environment Council </span><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>  <p><strong><span style="font-family: times new roman;">NB: If you have any questions and comments please contact the council member for the concerned council in your residence, Thank you</span></strong><span style="font-family: times new roman;"></span></p>
title: Res Life: Councils
